title: Nike's Run Could Continue to New Highs
text:
During the Lightning Round segment of Mad Money callers get to call in and ask Jim Cramer about his opinion of stocks they have an interested in. Nike (NKE) was one of the names that came up Friday night. "I think this stock goes higher. That was a great quarter," said Cramer.

Let's check out the charts and indicators.

In the daily bar chart of NKE, bellow, we can see that prices consolidated from February to late September before recently breaking out to the upside. Prices are above the rising 50-day simple moving average line and above the rising 200-day moving average line.

The movement of the daily On-Balance-Volume matches the price strength and confirms the move to the upside. The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is pointed up from above the zero line to add to the bullish story.

In the weekly bar chart of NKE, below, we can see that prices made a new high for the move up and NKE is above the rising 40-week moving average line. The weekly OBV line is close to a new high for the move up and this will be a good confirming indicator.

The weekly MACD oscillator just crossed to the upside from above the zero line for a fresh outright go long signal.

In this Point and Figure chart of NKE, below, we can see a potential upside price target of $107.

Bottom-line strategy: Maintain NKE longs and add to longs on strength. Risk a close below $89 now and look for strength to the $107 area.
description: Nike's Run Could Continue to New Highs...NKE
authors: Nike'S Run Could Continue To New Highs
A Look At Nike'S Latest Charts
